qas.question: What is the average temperature during winter?

answers.text: sometimes sees light snow or flurries

qas.question: How often does the temperature drop below -5 C

context: Spring and autumn have, on average, mild days and fresh nights but are changing and unstable. Surprisingly warm or cool weather occurs frequently in both seasons. In winter, sunshine is scarce; days are cold but generally above freezing with temperatures around <a0_0>7 °C<a0_0/> (45 °F). Light night frosts are however quite common, but the temperature will dip below −5 °C (23 °F) for only <a2_0>a few days a year<a2_0/>. Snow falls every year, but rarely stays on the ground. The city <a1_0>sometimes sees light snow or flurries<a1_0/> with or without accumulation.
